article.headline: Fordham 71, Lafayette 52
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Marcus Stout scored 14 of his 20 points in the second half to lead Fordham to a 71-52 victory over Lafayette on Saturday. Jermaine Anderson added 13 points for the Rams (4-8), while Bryant Dunston had 12. Bilal Abdullah had 12 points for the Leopards (5-6), and Andrei Capusan added 11. Everest Schmidt hit a game-opening jumper to give Lafayette its only lead and the Rams went on a 13-4 run with Dunston and Stout each getting four points. Two free throws by Corey McCrae with 3:16 left gave the Rams their biggest lead of the half, 27-14. The Leopards closed the half on a 7-2 run. But Stout had nine points and Anderson hit two 3-pointers as Fordham opened the second half on a 28-12 run that made it 57-33 with 10:29 to play.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
